TopicTitle: Could there be an asteroid belt eventually implemented into later versions?

Articles.Content:
Now that Squad is making it to where there are random asteroid occurrences around Kerbin, does that mean that eventually an actual "asteroid belt" between Duna and Jool could be possible? That would make it a little bit more challenging to space travelers going beyond the orbit of Duna or going to Dres. Imagine the scientific opportunities if you could land on or orbit one of the giant space rocks.

Edited March 24, 2014 by ExplicitPaarthurnax
Harv has said that it could be a possibility someday, but he didn't seem to want to expand further.

I don't know if you know this, but asteroid belts don't actually look like this:

The danger of going through one is almost non-existent. You'd have to do some maneuvering to even come close to an asteroid, so it wouldn't be that hard to make. I bet some modder will find a way to make them spawn in a certain orbit, so that is resembles a belt.

I highly doubt it. The Current version gives randomly generated asteroids, that if not focused on disappear. This is very important for RAM for the game. So having an asteroid belt with any significant number of asteroids will significantly slow down the game.

Maybe there could be a iteration of the game that has generated asteroids in a belt, but a permanent belt with a large number of asteroids will never come due to limitations with the engine, and computers.
It would kinda give an idea of how Dres was formed and/or where it came from.
Danny's new video, incidentally, illustrates rather entertainingly why asteroid belts aren't that hazardous after all - even if you TRY to hit an asteroid, you're more likely than not to miss.

Why a belt? If we can get a hold on the system that spawns asteroids around kerbin, why not have it spawn them around dres? Or around the active vessel as it approaches a particular altitude? That would simulate a 'belt' without the need for persistent rocks. And would it cost memory or CPU time? Not every asteroid is going to have a unique model. While on rails they can exist as a set of coordinates in a defined orbit. That doesn't eat much memory.
